intro: Aulonemia ulei, commonly known as the oil plant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in whorls along the stems. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has also been used in traditional medicine. The leaves are lance-shaped and can be used to extract essential oils.
